data.name: SD3: Chocolate Cake Drums - Funktight Kit
data.detailed_description:
Cakewalk has teamed up with ChocolateAudio to bring you the Chocolate Cake Drums: Funktight Kit for Session Drummer 3. If you have a sweet tooth for high-quality drum sounds then Chocolate Cake Drums are sure to satisfy. This kit was meticulously sampled by the artisans at ChocolateAudio to create some of the most authentic virtual drums available.

Highlights:

  • A DW kit with DW wooden snare: 22"x18" kick, 14", 16", 18" Toms, 14"x6" Snare, Paiste Cymbals.
  • Recorded ay 96KHz/24bit at ChocolateAudio Studio, delivered at 44.1KHz/24bit.
  • Recorded and Produced by Simone Coen for ChocolateAudio. Editing and programming by Simone Coen and Sara Rusignuolo.
  • Kick: 16 velocities - 2 variations (round robins) - Total: 32 samples.
  • Snare: Side 24 velocities, Standard Hit 24 velocities - 2 variations (round robins), Rim Hit 24 velocities - 2 variations (round robins) - Total: 120 samples.
  • Hat 14": Pedal 16 velocities, Tip and Shank with 16 velocities - 2 variations - 5 positions (closed to open) (the 3 extra positions apart from closed and fully open are mapped as Percussions) - Total: 336 samples.
  • Ride: 16 velocities - 3 positions (Bell, Mid and Edge) - Total: 48 samples.
  • Toms: 3 Toms (Hi, Low and Floor) 16 velocities - 2 variations (round robins) each - Total: 96 samples.
  • Cymbals: Crash 14", Crash 18", China 18" with 16 velocities each and Splash 10" and 8" (6 velocities each) - Total: 60 samples.
  • TOTAL: 692 samples.

data.short_description: Cakewalk has teamed up with ChocolateAudio to bring you the Chocolate Cake Drums: Funktight Kit for Session Drummer 3. If you have a sweet tooth for high-quality drum sounds then Chocolate Cake Drums are sure to satisfy.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7, 8, or 10 (32- or 64-bit)
  • Processor: 2.6GHz Intel or AMD multi-core processor
  • Graphics: 1280x800 (1920 x 1080+ recommended)
  • Storage: 350 MB available space
  • Sound Card: ASIO compatible hardware is recommended
